articles.title: 'Repurposed' drugs showing promise as COVID-19 treatments: Chief Scientist - ABC News
articles.description: Australia's Chief Scientist Dr Alan Finkel has been been chairing the 'Rapid Response Information Forum', set up to support the Government with information during the Covid-19 crisis.
articles.content:
Australia's Chief Scientist Dr Alan Finkel has been playing an important role during the COVID-19 crisis, he's been chairing the 'Rapid Response Information Forum'.

articles.title: Tests show UVC lamps could light the way in virus fight - Medical Xpress
articles.description: Could a new type of ultraviolet lamp be used in stations, airplanes and schools to kill dangerous viruses, becoming a gamechanger in the COVID-19 fight?
articles.content:

articles.author: BLAIR RICHARDS
articles.title: Tasmania has again recorded no new cases of coronavirus - The Mercury
articles.description: FOR a third day in a row Tasmania has recorded no new cases of coronavirus.
articles.content:
FOR a third day in a row Tasmania has recorded no new cases of coronavirus.
In an update on Sunday night, Public Health director Mark Veitch said the number of cases detected in the state remained at 225.

articles.author: CNN
articles.title: Study shows COVID-19 patients who took heartburn drug were less likely to die, but researchers caution more research is needed - 9News
articles.description: Patients who took a common heartburn medicine while hospitalised for COVID-19 were more than twice as likely to survive the infection, according to a paper posted Friday on a pre-publication website.
